Where to meet us

The Vienna Convention Bureau team is present at the most important trade fairs, workshops and congresses around the world.

March 2019

  • 21 March: Paris, France - Pure Meetings & Events
  • 24-26 March: New York, USA - SMU
  • 26-28 March: Cannes, France - Heavent Meetings
  • 28-29 March: Berlin, Germany - IPCAA Meeting

April 2019

  • 07-09 April: Gothenburg, Sweden - Associations Congress

May 2019

  • 21-23 May: Frankfurt, Germany - IMEX
  • 25 May: Moskow, Russia - Customer Event
  • 28-31 May: Houston, Texas - Helms Briscoe ABC

June 2019

  • 12-13 June: Basel, Switzerland - Art Basel
  • 13-15 June: Helsinki, Finnland - The Meetings Space Summer
  • 14-15 June: Montreal, Canada - ICCA Client Supplier International Workshop
  • 19-22 June: Sibenik, Croatia - M&I Forum
  • 23-27 June: Los Angeles, USA - PCMA Education Conference
  • 24-25 June: Feldkirch, Austria - Convention4U
  • 27-29 June: Dehli, India - EPEX & WOW

July 2019

  • 28-31 July: Blatimore, USA - E4 - Maritz

August 2019

21-23 August: Chicago, USA - Maritz Collaborative

September 2019

  • 09-10 September: Moskow, Russia - Meeting Planners Russia
  • 10-12 September: Las Vegas, USA - IMEX USA
  • 26-28 September: Madrid, Spain - The Meetings Space Autumn

October 2019

  • 16-18 October: Singapur - ITB Asia
  • 21-26 October: Peking, Guangzhou, Shenzhen, Shanghai, China - Roadshow
  • 27-30 October: Houston, Texas - ICCA Kongress

November 2019

  • 11-15 November: Muscat, Oman - M&I Forum
  • 19-21 November: Barcelona, Spain - ibtm world
  • 28 November: London, Great Britain - Customer event

Sustainability & Green Meetings

3.5 kg of garbage, 5.5 kg of paper recycling, 151 l of water, 204 kg of carbon dioxide - these are the alarming waste figures which an average meeting guest generates per day!

Take part in climate protection and sustainable use of resources and turn your meeting into a Green Meeting. In 2018, 212 events were certified in Vienna as a Green Meeting.

A Green Meeting is characterised by greater energy efficiency, waste avoidance and an environmentally friendly arrival and departure of the guests. These are all points which help save costs. There is a possibility of having a Green Meeting certified with the Austrian Eco-label.

Kick off by ticking off! Make a contribution to environmental protection and organise a sustainable meeting by following our checklist.

Tourist Information

There are many good reasons to travel to Vienna: The city is world famous for its magnificent imperial heritage, for SchÃ¶nbrunn Palace, Belvedere Palace and for Hofburg Palace.

Vienna scores like no other city with its exceptional music and cultural programme in concert halls, museums and on stages from the Golden Hall in the Musikverein to the renowned Kunsthistorische Museum (Museum of Art History) right up to the Vienna State Opera. Vienna is also synonymous with a tradition of refined tasteful enjoyment which has established itself over centuries in the coffee houses and wine taverns.

And last but not least, over half of Vienna's urban area is made up of relaxing green spaces, parks and gardens, the Vienna Woods and the Danube Floodplains.

A walk through Vienna is like going on a journey through time to the imperial past. No wonder the historical city centre was named a world heritage site by UNESCO. Vienna boasts more than 27 castles and 163 palaces. On every corner you can discover valuable cultural artefacts or dream of the good old imperial period in a coffeehouse.

There is much to see: From Gothic St. Stephenâs Cathedral to the Imperial Palace to the Art Nouveau splendor of the Secession, from the magnificent â¦

Vienna is the worldâs capital of music â The Vienna Philharmonic and the Vienna Boysâ Choir set the international tone, while the State â¦

  • Special Offer Public Transportation

Special Offer Public Transportation

Wiener Linien's congress ticket is a customised public transport pass for large events.

The congress ticket enables both participants and their companions to make unlimited use of all means of public transport in Vienna (Kernzone Wien) for the entire duration of the event.

The fare per congress ticket (minimum number of tickets: 150) is EUR 17.60 for three days and an extra EUR 2.40 for each additional day. Wiener Linien also offers discounts of 20 % (from 5,000 tickets) to 30 % (from 10,000 tickets) for large congresses.

The congress ticket can be personalised by adding the logo of the event or some additional text. If over 5,000 tickets are ordered, the congress badge may even be used as the ticket.

Contact: Wiener Linien GmbH & Co KG, Department for Sales & Consulting, email: spezialtickets@wienerlinien.at

Print@Home ticket

It is also possible for each event participant to purchase their congress ticket online individually. At the request of the event organiser, Wiener Linien will provide an online link to be forwarded to the participants or published. If this is desired, please send an email enquiry to ticketshop@wienerlinien.at.

This ticket offers the following additional advantages:

  • 10 % discount per ticket (no minimum purchase amount)
  • In the event of loss or theft, the ticket can be reprinted.
  • The City Airport Train (CAT) can be included for an additional fee.
  • The ticket can be displayed on a smartphone using the WienMobil app (iOS and Android).

HOFBURG Vienna insights

01 April 2019 - Partner News - A high degree of flexibility, state-of-the-art technology allow to add an individual touch to any event. An ideal backdrop for banquets, lounges or exhibitions. New insights offer our inspiration gallery presenting the new image video HOFBURG Vienna.

Pictures often tell more than thousand words. The new videos HOFBURG Vienna and HOFBURG Silvesterball have been added to our "Inspiration Gallery", which presents our international conference and event centre in the heart of Vienna. Dip into our event world and explore 35 rooms and halls for up to 4,900 people, and 320 events attracting more than 300,000 participants each year, the HOFBURG Vienna is the hotspot for a surprisingly wide range of get-togethers.

Inspirational ideas for your event: Emotionally appealing visuals and the dynamic design of the film sequences in the HOFBURG Vienna image video provide a range of impressions from the events of today and yesterday. "The word 'premium' is the best way to sum up our strategy of transforming an event into something unforgettable," Alexandra Kaszay explains. Spring will be given over to events such as the Pioneer's 2019 or the Forum Prävention 2019 and the International Vienna Motor Symposium will celebrate its 40th anniversary in the state rooms. The HOFBURG Vienna's fantastic mix of events each year highlights its versatility as a venue, which has earned it a place among the leaders on the Austrian and international market.

HOFBURG Vienna as a state-of-the-art location and as a meeting place for contemporary events: http://www.hofburg.com/imagevideo.


Contact: HOFBURG Vienna
Magdalena Gurtner-Köpf/ Elisabeth Lischka
Manager Sales & Business Development
T + 43 1 5873666 611, F + 43 1 535 64 26
m.gurtner@hofburg.com, e.lischka@hofburg.com
www.hofburg.com

Hotels & Accommodation

Vienna offers about 428 hotels, pensions and apartments.

Sleep & Meet

  • 428 hotels, 34,337 rooms to suit all tastes and budgets
  • Classic luxury & modern design
  • Austrian & international hotel chains
  • Private hotels, budget design hotels & guest houses

Meet & Sleep

  • Around 100 conference hotels in different categories
  • Meetings for up to 1,000 delegates in one room
  • Up to 18 meeting rooms under one roof
  • For a detailed search: Venue Finder

Hotel Overview

21 five star hotels with 3,944 rooms
164 four star hotels 16,275 rooms
172 three star hotels 11,359 rooms
71 two star and one star hotels 2,759 rooms
______________________________________________________

Total 428 hotels with 34,337 rooms

Included in these figures are eight seasonal hotels (student halls of residence which serve as low-cost seasonal hostels) offering 539 rooms. These are only available between July and September.

Last update: November 2018

List of Accommodations


Planned openings by 2022: about 19 hotels with some 2,900 rooms
Details: New hotels & hotel projects

  • Statistics

Statistics

In 2018, around 12% of all overnight stays in Vienna was in the area of congresses, meetings and incentives.

The Vienna Convention Bureau has been keeping statistics since 1991 in order to:

  • measure the economic significance, business development and marketing activities
  • know what is going on in the region
  • be comparable with other tourist segments
  • be able to present better economic arguments when creating new infrastructure
  • create an awareness for the economic significance and the importance of the meeting and incentive industry
  • increase the acceptance of the business segment
  • lobby and promote the meeting destination Vienna
  • document the abilities of the meeting industry in Vienna
Download Vienna Meetings Industry Report 2018

Download Vienna Meetings Industry Report 2017

  • CSR & Sustainability for Organisers

CSR & Sustainability for Organisers

Would you like to do your bit during your event in Vienna? Would you like to give back to the community?

We have prepared some possibilities:

  • Vinziport (homeless shelter): Accepts food donations
  • Gruft (homeless shelter): Accepts catering leftovers
  • Caritas: Volunteer time to accept and sort donations
  • Wiener Tafel (food bank): With the "Tafelbox" participants can donate leftover food from an event
  • Hilfswerk: Leftover promotional material from an event can be donated
  • Ärzte ohne Grenzen (providing medical help for people in need): Organization of a call for donations during the event or of an information stand where this NGO can present its services
  • CO2 compensation for people arriving by plane, train or car at myclimate.org or climateaustria.at
  • Austrian National Library: Become a book sponsor on a topic of your choice

The Vienna Convention Bureau is happy to assist you, please contact Elisabeth Millington for more information.

Quality requirements:
All of the agencies listed have to comply with a quality standard. Every year they send the Vienna Convention Bureau information and references about organised events as well as an overview of the events for which they have been contracted in the future. The PCOs all approve of the basic agreement for hotel bookings for international congresses in Vienna (not for corporate events).

    Proposal

Request for Proposal

Thank you for considering Vienna for your next event. We will be happy to assist you in planning your event for more than 50 participants. Our venue finder and its filter functions will also help you to select your suitable venue.

Please fill in the following form, completing all mandatory fields marked with *, and we will get in touch with you presently.

Organiser

Title *

Planned event

Here you can upload your RFP document or enter your event information.
Venue
Location

Event details

Hotel accommodation

Hotel category

By transmitting the data provided in the query form you provide your consent to the processing for the purposes of supporting planning for the event and to aid communication with you. Provision of your data is required so that we can process your inquiry. The information you provide, such as name, address, contact and business data are stored in our database and are erased or anonymized when you withdraw your consent. You can withdraw your consent at any time by sending a message to convention@vienna.info, in which case we will not be able to assist you further. We do not give your data to third parties except in the situations described in our Privacy Policy, such as when data storage is handled by a processor. In the event that you provide separate consent, we may forward your details to venues/hotels in order to prepare quotes and communicate with you. If you have any questions about data security, please contact our Data Protection Officer at datenschutz@wien.info.

About us

The Vienna Convention Bureau was established in 1969 as a department of the Vienna Tourist Board with the help of the city of Vienna and the Vienna Chamber of Commerce.

The Vienna Convention Bureau is supported by



www.wien.gv.at 
www.wko.at

Additional funds for the Vienna Convention Bureau come from sponsors. The Vienna Convention Bureau has no members.

The Vienna Convention Bureau is a member in the leading umbrella organisations and associations for the national and international meeting industry: ACB, Destinations International, ICCA, MPI, PCMA and UIA.

Congresses, corporate meetings and incentives are an important part of Vienna’s tourist industry. Around 12% of all overnight stays in Vienna in 2016 were in this area. The exceptional meeting infrastructure, the excellent service standard of the congress service sector as well as the cultural attractiveness of the city are all factors that contribute to making Vienna a top destination worldwide for international meetings.

The Vienna Convention Bureau has set itself the task of promoting awareness on sustainable actions in the sector and supports initiatives and projects on the topics of Green Meetings, sustainability and corporate social responsibility. You can find more information about this in the chapter Sustainability & Green Meetings.

Our cooperation partners offer our clients in the USA, Canada, the UK and Ireland as well as China free advice about Vienna:

Incentive Ideas & Social Events Programmes

Even outside the meeting room Vienna offers countless ways to network or to increase the motivation of participants.

Are you interested in one of the ideas below? Please contact the team of the Vienna Convention Bureau or one of the agencies in Vienna who will be pleased to assist you in planning and organizing your programme.

Viennese originals

The capital of music

Welcome to the worldâs music capital! More famous composers have lived here than in any other city â in Vienna, music is literally in the air.

History and Tall Tales

Fun and thought-provoking programs brimming with Viennese charm and amusing historical anecdotes.

Ballet of the White Stallions

The Lipizzaner stallions at the Spanish Riding School, one of the oldest in the world, are the perfect embodiment of the fine art of classic â¦

Celebrate like an Emperor

Opulent city palaces, museums and historic locations provide the perfect setting for out-of-the-ordinary evening events and costume balls.

Cocktail on top

The Giant Ferris Wheel in the Prater is one of the city's symbols. Almost 65 meters tall, it offers a breathtaking view of the city on the Danube.

Animal magic

SchÃ¶nbrunn Zoo is the world's oldest zoo â and it is certainly one of the most picturesque.

Third Man Tour

Tour of Vienna's labyrinthine sewers.

Empress for an evening

Show your participants SchÃ¶nbrunn Palace in an exclusive, intimate soirÃ©e â as part of a private tour outside normal opening hours.

In perfect time

No visit to Vienna would be complete without dancing the waltz.

Sports activities

Puzzling Vienna

A treasure hunt through the old town is an unforgettable way to discover the city, the people and the Viennese dialect.

Viennese wilderness

Thrillseekers will be in their element in the Vienna Woods, on the Danube Island and in the extensive Prater park, where outdoor pursuits are very much â¦

The wind is picking up

Many people dream of flying. This dream can come true in Vienna!

Rollercoaster fun

Events at the Prater amusement park.

Dragon boat racing

Bring your team closer together with one of the most successful team building exercises out there.

Marina magic in the heart of Vienna

And plenty of action for adrenaline junkies.

Culinary activities

The Viennese Heurige

The epitome of Viennese enjoyment: an informal evening at a typical Heurige wine tavern.

The art of Apple Strudel baking

It is time to pick up some tips from a master of the art!

The art of cake making

For more than two centuries Demel has been famous for its fine confectionery and baked goods.

Cook like the pros

Did you know that Viennese Cuisine is the only cuisine in the world to be named after a city?

Cheers

Wine, sparkling wine and gin tasting.

Beer brewing workshop

Key in on the high art of craft beer brewing and discover skills you didn't know you had.

Artistic activities

Artistic Pursuits

Let your imagination run free at an art workshop in one of Vienna's museums.

Art out of a can

Vienna is not only the home of classical art â the city is also a place where you can try your hand at modern graffiti.

Polaroid Tour of Vienna

Explore Vienna through the lens of a Polaroid camera on an Instant Tour.

The journey is the reward

Danube so blue

Enjoy a trip along the blue Danube to the Wachau Valley.

Time travel

The Majestic Imperator Train de Luxe is the epitome of imperial opulence from the golden age of railways.

On tour

The journey back in time starts right here!

Motorized soapbox rally through Vienna

These 14 horsepower soapbox cars are a great way to explore Vienna.

Vienna Sight Running

Discover Vienna and its sights at speed, on your own two feet.

Twin City Liner

The high-speed catamaran whisks guests from Vienna to Bratislava in just 75 minutes.

Getting to Vienna

Be it by plane, train or car - there are many ways to get to Vienna.

Fast & efficient

  • At most Vienna is three-hour flight away from all European capital cities
  • Just 20 minutes by taxi and 16 minutes by City Airport Train from the airport to the city centre
  • Efficient and safe public transportation system
  • 1,500 city bikes

By plane

Vienna's central position in Europe makes it a hub offering optimal transportation connections to the whole world. 205 destinations across 71 countries are â¦

By train

The train is a comfortable way to travel to Vienna. The products of ÃBB (Austrian Federal Railways) and the Westbahn are aimed at individual travel needs.

By car and bus

Youâll have a safe journey to Vienna by car and bus on Austriaâs excellent network of motorways, expressways and federal highways.

  • Value Added Tax

Value Added Tax

We have summarised the essentials regarding Value Added Tax (VAT) in connection with congresses.

General facts

According to EU VAT law, participation fees for congresses and fairs are always taxable in the country where the congress takes place. Congresses held in Austria and their participation fees are subject to Austrian VAT legislation which stipulates that these fees are, in general, subject to 20% VAT which need to be charged to the participants and paid to the local Austrian tax authority.

In in order to make the payments to the authority it is necessary to register with the Austrian tax authority, obtain an Austrian VAT-ID number and file VAT returns in Austria.

A significant part of the costs that are incurred by the congress organiser in Austria will be charged by the suppliers with Austrian VAT. The standard VAT rate in Austria is 20% and applies, for example, to the rent of the congress venue. Hotel room rates are subject to 10% Austrian VAT and transportation services are subject to 10% Austrian VAT. The VAT rate for catering services depends on the actual service (10% for food and 20% for drinks). This input VAT (i.e. VAT that is charged to the organisation by its suppliers) is deductible according to the general rules under Austrian VAT law.

Income from sponsoring and the rental of exhibition stands is usually seen as a service that falls under the B2B general rule and is therefore taxable at the place where the recipient has established its business (reverse charge).

Special rules for charitable organisations

Austrian tax law has very attractive tax privileges for charitable organizations.

Whether or not an organisation is regarded as charitable organisation for Austrian tax purposes has to be scrutinised under Austrian tax law only. Given that the regulations concerning charitable organisations are not harmonised within the European Union, the charitable status in another EU member state may only be an indication but is not sufficient from an Austrian tax perspective. The prerequisites for being tax exempt for charitable organisations in Austria needs to be checked in detail on a case-by-case basis.

If an organisation is treated as a charitable organisation under Austrian tax law, it has the following options:
The organisation could opt to be treated as a non-entrepreneur in connection with the congress in Austria so that no VAT would be payable. Consequently, the organisation would not be allowed to deduct input VAT, resulting in higher costs for the congress (i.e. rental of the congress venue, catering, etc.).
If the organisation opts to be treated as an entrepreneur, it can apply the reduced VAT rate of 10% for the participation fees. Input VAT can be fully deducted under the general rules.

In order to determine the most favourable option, it is usually preferable to prepare a budget of the expected revenue and costs of the congress.

If the participation fees are dictated by the market, the option to charge 10% VAT is usually more favourable (10% VAT for participation fees would need to be paid to the tax authority whereas usually 20% input VAT for services received can be reclaimed).

Both for registering an organisation for VAT purposes in Austria as well as checking the charitable status (if applicable), professional tax advice is highly recommended. It is not possible under Austrian tax law to not register for VAT purposes without a detailed check of a possible charitable status of an organisation. If Austrian taxes are not correctly paid, the legal representatives of the organisation may be held personally liable and subject to severe penalties under the Austrian Fiscal Penalty Law.

If required, you can use the services of a specialised Austrian tax accountant such as:

Deloitte Wien
Mr. Christoph Hofer
chhofer@deloitte.at
http://www.deloitte.at

TPA Horwath
Ms. Veronika Seitweger
veronika.seitweger@tpa-horwath.com
http://www.tpa-horwath.com

About the VCB

We are happy to assist you! Our job is to promote the position of Vienna as the most prominent meeting and incentive city in Central Europe. We are happy to accompany the planning and preparation for every national and international organiser of congresses, conferences and incentives.

About us

The Vienna Convention Bureau was established in 1969 as a department of the Vienna Tourist Board with the help of the city of Vienna and the Vienna Chamber of â¦

Team

The team of the Vienna Convention Bureau is happy to assist you.

Our Services

As a neutral contact for the destination Vienna we assist you free of charge in planning and preparing your meeting or incentive in Vienna.

Where to meet us

The Vienna Convention Bureau team is present at the most important trade fairs, workshops and congresses around the world.

Sponsors

The Vienna Convention Bureau wishes to thank its sponsors for their valuable support.

Follow us on LinkedIn!
